snippet: The new policy guidelines will allow hundreds of mixed-income rental buildings to sell most of their apartments as long as they permanently preserve their low-income rentals or increase their number.
abstract: New policy guidelines will allow landlords in New York City to sell their market-rate rentals--or up to 80 percent of an individual building--in exchange for preserving or expanding the number of low-income rental apartments they own; must commit to making at least 20 percent of their units permanently affordable before any sales are approved.
